text: Andrey Yakunin (Андрей Владимирович Якунин) (born 1975) is a London-based businessman, chairman of the National Alternative Investment Management Association (NAIMA) in Russia, and the co-founder of VIY Management. Andrey Yakunin has British citizenship and citizenship of the Russian Federation. ==Early life and family== Andrey Yakunin is the eldest son of Vladimir Yakunin, the former head of Russian Railways and an old friend of Vladimir Putin. His mother is Natalya. Andrey has a brother, Viktor Yakunin. Andrey Yakunin lives in Hampstead, north London, where his son, Igor, attended the exclusive Highgate School.House of Secrets. Ed Caesar, The New Yorker. Retrieved 25 May 2015. ==Education== Yakunin holds a Ph.D. in Finance and Credit from St. Petersburg State University, an MA degree in Economics and Mathematics, and EMBA Global from London Business School and Columbia University Graduate School of Business. Retrieved 25 May 2015. Yakunin is an associate professor of economics at the St Petersburg State University. ==Career== Yakunin runs VIY Management, a private equity and real estate investment company Retrieved 25 May 2015. which he founded in 2006Team. VIY Management, 2014. Retrieved 25 May 2015. with British, Israeli-born, investor Yair Ziv. The company facilitates foreign investment in Russia and is pursuing a plan to build hotels in Russia."Russian Railways’ family connections". Douglas Busvine and Stephen Grey, Reuters, 25 July 2012.
